nodes.title: Build weaver.sh - decentralized notebook platform on AT Protocol
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":95,"prompt":"Dissatisfaction with existing long-form writing platforms, especially on ATProto at the time. Inspired by weaver birds building homes, and by notebooks (physical and virtual) used for ideation, documentation, and information. Vision: elegant writing platform with collaborative editing and immediate publishing. Ultimate goal: professional-grade platform for writers/journalists, open alternative to Substack, with reader support mechanisms, all on AT Protocol."}

nodes.title: Build jacquard - better AT Protocol library for Rust
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":95,"prompt":"Frustrated with atrium library - significant boilerplate, poor ergonomics, maintenance concerns. Wanted something better, figured others did too. Built jacquard with zero-copy patterns, better type system, built-in OAuth, cleaner APIs. Developed largely for weaver but designed to benefit the broader Rust/ATProto ecosystem."}

nodes.title: Choose frontend technology for weaver-app
Dioxus (Rust → WASM)
JavaScript framework (React/Vue/Svelte)
Build custom markdown editor vs use existing library
Build custom Rust editor from scratch
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":95,"prompt":"Chosen because: 1) No web-based rich text editor existed in Rust. 2) Wanted to use custom markdown dialect with additional features (weaver-flavoured markdown forked from pulldown-cmark, porting features from Obsidian-flavoured markdown with further additions). 3) pulldown-cmark's Rust optimization is significantly faster than JS parsers. 4) Wanted documents editable with any text editor (like Obsidian vault files), not block-based formats. 5) Extending JS libs (ProseMirror/Lexical) for custom markdown wasn't appealing."}

nodes.title: Use existing JS editor (ProseMirror/CodeMirror/Lexical)
Editor text storage model
JumpRope (initial choice)
Ropey (current/planned for core)
Loro (for CRDT/collab)
Editor input handling model
beforeinput event interception (ProseMirror-style)
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":95,"prompt":"Chosen approach: Use contenteditable only for rendering and cursor display. Intercept all edit operations via beforeinput, modify source rope directly, re-render. Single source of truth (the rope), full control over all editing operations, cursor restoration is well-defined. More upfront code but no ongoing sync bugs."}

nodes.title: Hidden textarea + contenteditable overlay
weaver-index backend architecture
Dual-backend: ClickHouse + SQLite shards
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":95,"prompt":"ClickHouse for network-wide data (all records, aggregates, search, discovery). SQLite shards for hot-tier latency-sensitive operations (edit/collab state, sharded by resource URI). Router uses NSID prefix matching to direct records. Materialized views maintain denormalized read tables. Incremental MVs for counts, refreshable MVs for trending scores."}

nodes.title: Extract editor for external embedding
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":90,"prompt":"Extract the weaver markdown editor into a standalone, embeddable package. Target consumers: external apps (MTG deckbuilder, etc.) via JS/WASM, weaver-app itself (dogfooding, potential framework migration), future native apps via Rust crate. Host app controls auth, blob uploads, collab transport, publishing. Clean crate boundary: core (pure Rust, no web_sys/dioxus/loro), crdt (optional Loro), browser (web_sys DOM layer), js (thin wrapper)."}

nodes.title: Obsidian-style editing UX is key requirement
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":95,"prompt":"Hide formatting characters contextually based on cursor position. Documents should be plain markdown text files, editable with any text editor. Not block-based editing like Notion/Tiptap - documents are files, not proprietary formats. This drove the decision to stick with markdown rather than rich-text block formats that Loro/Yjs natively support."}

nodes.title: weaver-flavoured markdown extends pulldown-cmark
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":90,"prompt":"Custom markdown dialect with additional features, forked from pulldown-cmark. Ports features from Obsidian-flavoured markdown plus further additions. Includes wiki links, embeds, math, sidenotes. The fork lives in a separate repo (markdown-weaver). This customization is a key differentiator and why JS parsers weren't suitable."}

nodes.title: Jacquard migration completed - cleaner codebase, better DX
weaver-app live at alpha.weaver.sh
weaver-index live at index.weaver.sh
Custom editor working - Obsidian-style markdown editing functional
CRDT collab via Loro operational
AT Protocol authentication approach
Public web client (PKCE, no secret)
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":90,"prompt":"Current implementation. Auth method: none (public client). PKCE flow for security. Client-side state in browser localStorage/sessionStorage. BrowserAuthStore implements ClientAuthStore. No JWKs required. Works for both dev (localhost loopback) and production modes."}

nodes.title: Confidential client (server-side OAuth)
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":60,"prompt":"Future enhancement. Server-side OAuth with JWKs. Would enable more secure flows, refresh token rotation. Planned but not implemented."}

nodes.title: Subdomain hosting for notebooks
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":70,"prompt":"Design exploration (not yet implemented). Allow notebooks at custom subdomains (e.g., mynotebook.weaver.sh) in addition to path-based routing. Clean URLs for published notebooks. Opens door to custom domains later. Selected approach: single app with host context injection, not separate apps or path rewriting."}

nodes.title: JS bindings for weaver-renderer
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":70,"prompt":"Design exploration. WASM bindings for weaver-renderer so external JS apps can render weaver content without reimplementing. Package: weaver-renderer-js. No network calls in WASM - JS handles fetches. Good TS types via tsify. Enables embedding weaver content in other atproto apps (e.g., MTG deckbuilder). Related to editor extraction - both expose functionality to JS consumers."}

nodes.title: Editor text buffer migration
Migrated from JumpRope to Loro CRDT
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":95,"prompt":"Nov 2025. Replaced JumpRopeBuf with Loro for undo/redo + future collaboration. Key insight: use detached LoroText per paragraph for UTF-16 conversion (chars_to_wchars replacement). OffsetTracker for incremental UTF-16 tracking during render. Bundle size acceptable (~970KB). UndoManager with 300ms merge interval, 100 max steps. Limitation: undo is session-only, can't rebuild history from imported CRDT ops."}

nodes.title: Implemented conditional syntax hiding
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":90,"prompt":"Obsidian-style: syntax markers hidden when cursor not near, revealed on approach. CSS-based (not re-render) - offset maps unchanged since TreeWalker counts all text nodes including display:none. Each syntax span gets data-syn-id, data-char-start, data-char-end. VisibilityState calculates which spans visible. Inline: show if cursor within 1 char of boundaries. Block: show if cursor anywhere in same paragraph."}

nodes.title: Implemented IME composition support
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":90,"prompt":"CJK input, dead keys, emoji pickers. Let browser handle composition preview (underlined text, candidate window). Suppress DOM updates during composition. Block keydown during composition (except Escape). Single insert on compositionend. Selection deleted on compositionstart. Blocked from oninput approach because Dioxus FormData doesn't expose InputEvent's input_type/data/is_composing."}

nodes.title: sh.weaver lexicon namespace design
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":90,"prompt":"Custom AT Protocol lexicons under sh.weaver namespace. Key record types: notebook.entry (markdown content, title, path, tags, authors, embeds), notebook.book (collection), edit.root (CRDT snapshot starting point), edit.diff (incremental edits), collab.session (real-time session with iroh nodeId), collab.invite/accept (collaboration permissions), graph.* (likes, bookmarks, follows, tags). updatedAt for canonicality tiebreaking in multi-author scenarios."}

nodes.title: Collaborative editing transport
iroh P2P with DERP relay fallback
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":85,"prompt":"collab.session record contains iroh NodeId (z-base32) for direct P2P and optional relayUrl for browser clients. Gossip-based CRDT sync. Session TTL with refresh. Session record published on join, deleted on disconnect. Enables P2P without central server, falls back to relay when direct connection impossible."}

nodes.title: Implemented static site theming system
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":95,"prompt":"October 2025: Added Theme struct with colors/fonts/spacing, CSS generation, syntax highlighting via syntect, full HTML5 document output"}

nodes.title: Implemented CLI static site integration
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":95,"prompt":"October 2025: Added weaver <source> <dest> command, optional auth loading, graceful degradation without network"}

nodes.title: Added static site renderer tests
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":90,"prompt":"October 2025: Made reqwest client optional in StaticSiteContext for testability, added snapshot tests via insta"}

nodes.title: Two-stage AT Protocol rendering pipeline
Stage 1: Markdown preprocessing (CLI)
Stage 2: Client-side rendering (WASM)
Implemented browser OAuth with BrowserAuthStore
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":95,"prompt":"Nov 2025: PKCE flow, localStorage+sessionStorage, Signal-based client swapping in CachedFetcher"}

nodes.title: Record editing interface approach
Two editing modes: JSON Editor + Pretty Editor
Root Signal pattern for editing nested Data
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":90,"prompt":"Pretty Editor architecture uses single root signal with path-based traversal for editing AT Protocol records. All nested components receive root signal + path string."}

nodes.title: Implemented editor integration with route structure
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":90,"prompt":"Nov 2025: Added /e/, /drafts, /new, /edit routes. Draft system with local-only vs server-synced states. Profile page actions."}

nodes.title: Draft system fixes - entry context, notebook URI, deletion, auth
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":90,"prompt":"Dec 2025: Fixed 4 issues - entry context lost on PDS-only loads, notebook duplication on publish, incomplete draft deletion, missing auth on listDrafts"}

nodes.title: Editor render pipeline redesign
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":90,"prompt":"Dec 2025: Fixed cursor/end-of-doc, spaces not typed, paragraph boundary bugs. Single full render pass, content-based IDs (p-{hash}-{idx}), pool-based DOM diffing."}

nodes.title: Editor cursor bugs - orphan spans, offset map gaps
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":85,"prompt":"Dec 2025: Safari/Chrome specific. emit_syntax creating orphan spans before paragraphs, ZWC cleanup issues, offset map not covering document end."}

nodes.title: WCAG 2.2 Level AA accessibility compliance
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":75,"prompt":"Dec 2025: Editor lacks most accessibility features. ATAG 2.0 Part A (accessible UI) and Part B (help create accessible content) apply. EAA compliance increasingly important."}

nodes.title: Current accessibility gaps - contenteditable role, toolbar navigation, focus management
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":85,"prompt":"Missing: role=textbox on editor, aria-multiline, roving tabindex in toolbar, focus trap in dialogs, live regions for status updates"}

nodes.title: Offset iterator migration for sidenote gap detection
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":85,"prompt":"Dec 2025: Switching static_site and atproto writers to offset_iter() tuples. Enables byte-offset gap detection for sidenote paragraph handling (gap <= 2 bytes = continue, > 2 = new paragraph)"}

nodes.title: Collab worker design - iroh P2P into dedicated web worker
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":85,"prompt":"Jan 2025: Move iroh/gossip/loro to web worker. Reactor pattern via gloo-worker. Main thread handles auth'd PDS ops. Reduces main binary size."}

nodes.title: LoroBuffer type implementing TextBuffer + UndoManager traits
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":90,"prompt":"Jan 2026: Bridge between weaver-editor-core traits and Loro CRDT. Wraps LoroDoc + LoroText + loro::UndoManager."}

nodes.title: weaver-index dual-backend detail - ClickHouse for network-wide, SQLite shards for collab
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":95,"prompt":"Dec 2025: ClickHouse for all records + aggregates + search. SQLite sharded by resource URI for edit/collab hot tier with sub-ms latency."}

nodes.title: Editor Phase 1: JumpRope-based text storage with char offsets
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":95,"prompt":"Nov 2025: Initial MVP using JumpRopeBuf. CursorState with affinity. LocalStorage persistence. Char offsets (not bytes) for rope operations."}

nodes.title: Clipboard fixes and Loro CRDT investigation
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":90,"prompt":"Nov 2025: Fixed cut/copy/delete. Investigated Loro for undo + collab. Key insight: LoroDoc models entire entry (text + blobs + metadata), not just text."}

nodes.title: Sidenotes: inline footnotes in virtual paragraphs
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":85,"prompt":"Sidenotes vs traditional footnotes distinguished by gap size. Single newline = sidenote (inline), blank line = traditional footnote. defer_paragraph_close flag handles HTML output."}

nodes.title: Segmented writer refactor - single full render producing segmented output
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":90,"prompt":"Dec 2025: Eliminate double-parsing. SegmentedWriter struct. Per-paragraph data tracking (offset maps, syntax spans, refs). Stable paragraph IDs."}

nodes.title: Secure session storage for sensitive keys
XOR secret sharing between sessionStorage + window.name
weaver-index XRPC endpoints tiered by priority
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":90,"prompt":"Tier 1 (critical/editing): getEditHistory, getCollaborationState via SQLite. Tier 2 (core UX): getProfile, getNotebook, getEntry via ClickHouse. Tier 3 (social): follows, likes, search."}

nodes.title: Editor AT Protocol integration - LoroDoc mirrors entry schema
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":90,"prompt":"Nov 2025: LoroDoc contains content, title, path, tags, embeds (nested structure). Image upload flow with PublishedBlob records. Storage key: draft:new:{uuid} or draft:{at-uri}."}

nodes.title: Editor performance fix - signal granularity + batched DOM queries
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":95,"prompt":"Signal refactor: individual signals for cursor/selection/content instead of Signal<EditorDocument>. Batch DOM visibility with querySelectorAll instead of N query_selector. All phases complete."}

nodes.title: weaver-app code review - significant technical debt
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":90,"prompt":"Dec 2025: ~17,500 LOC reviewed. 60-70% duplication in data.rs. God functions (800-line start_tag). ~15-20 real bugs. ~3000-4000 lines could be eliminated."}

nodes.title: SQLite shard concurrency pattern
rusqlite + spawn_blocking per request
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":85,"prompt":"Simpler. tokio handles thread pool. r2d2 connection pools per shard. Overhead: ~1-2μs per spawn_blocking call."}

nodes.title: TextBuffer trait abstraction for editor storage
Generic EditorDocument<T: TextBuffer> with ropey default
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":90,"prompt":"Jan 2026: TextBuffer trait provides common interface (insert, delete, slice, offset conversion). EditorRope for local, LoroBuffer for CRDT collab."}

nodes.title: Notebook UI redesign - skeumorphic aesthetics, profile caching
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":90,"prompt":"Nov 2025: Paper/blueprint aesthetics, profile sidebar with 30min cache TTL, notebook cover component, multi-author handling (show author only when count > 1), Rose Pine theming."}

nodes.title: weaver-editor-core extraction nearly complete
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":90,"prompt":"Jan 2026: TextBuffer trait + EditorRope impl done. UndoManager + UndoableBuffer done. EditorDocument trait + PlainEditor impl done. EditorWriter rendering engine extracted. No stubs - production ready."}

nodes.title: weaver-app editor: 25 files, 30K+ LOC with Loro CRDT
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":95,"prompt":"Current state: Fine-grained Signal reactivity working. Worker offloading for snapshots. PDS sync (edit.root + edit.diff) working. Real-time P2P collab scaffolded but iroh integration incomplete."}

nodes.title: weaver-index: 19 XRPC endpoints, 40 ClickHouse migrations
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":95,"prompt":"Jan 2026: Jetstream/Tap ingestion working. Profile/notebook/entry queries done. Edit history + collab state queries done. TODOs: popular sorting, collab grant validation."}

nodes.title: Lexicons: 13 record types, 50+ view/state types
nodes.metadata_json: {"confidence":95,"prompt":"Namespaces: sh.weaver.{notebook, edit, collab, graph, actor}. Records: book, entry, chapter, root, diff, draft, invite, accept, session, like, bookmark, tag, follow, subscribe, list, listitem, profile."}

nodes.title: Iroh P2P collab transport fully implemented - feature-gated behind collab-worker flag
Collab architecture complete: CollabCoordinator + EditorReactor worker + gossip protocol + presence tracking + session records

Editor extraction status: weaver-editor-core has TextBuffer trait, EditorRope (ropey), UndoableBuffer, PlainEditor, rendering/offset utils, syntect highlighting. weaver-app retains Dioxus editor component, DOM sync, input handling, collab coordinator, storage layer.

Loro architecture: weaver-editor-core deliberately Loro-free (uses ropey). Loro lives at weaver-app level - EditorDocument wraps LoroDoc for content/title/path/tags/embeds. weaver-index uses Loro for parsing draft snapshots. Clean separation enables standalone core.
Create weaver-editor-browser crate - web_sys DOM layer without Dioxus
browser: dom_sync.rs - DOM ↔ document sync
browser: cursor.rs - Selection API handling
browser: events.rs - beforeinput, keydown, paste handlers
browser: contenteditable.rs - editor element management
browser: embed worker - image/content resolution in worker thread
Create weaver-editor-crdt crate - optional Loro integration (+500KB)
crdt: LoroDocument impl EditorDocument (wraps LoroDoc + UndoManager)
crdt: sync.rs - export/import updates, version vectors
Phase 2: Update weaver-app to use extracted crates
app: SignalEditorDocument wrapper adding Dioxus signals to core document
app: Update editor component to use weaver-editor-core + weaver-editor-browser
app: Update collab to use weaver-editor-crdt
Phase 3: Create weaver-editor-js - npm package @weaver/editor
js: WASM bindings for Editor and CollabEditor
js: TypeScript view layer - mount/unmount, callbacks, lifecycle
js: npm publish as @weaver/editor
EditorDocument trait is THE shared interface - LoroDocument impls it, SignalEditorDocument wraps it. JS bindings should expose this interface if possible.
Expose EditorDocument interface in JS bindings?
Yes - TypeScript interface mirroring Rust trait, enables custom impls
No - concrete Editor/CollabEditor classes only, simpler API
Browser crate extraction approach - how to handle EditorDocument trait vs concrete type
Option 1: Make app EditorDocument impl core trait first, then extract browser code
Option 2: Extract browser code now with concrete type, refactor to generic later
Option 3: Create browser crate with trait bounds, update app impl simultaneously
Core blocker: app EditorDocument uses Signal accessors (cursor.read/write) but browser crate needs trait methods (cursor()/set_cursor()) for generic code
Chosen approach: browser crate impl against EditorDocument trait, extend trait as needed
Defer weaver-app reintegration until both browser AND crdt crates complete - cleaner dependency graph
Feature-gate dioxus_signals in weaver-editor-browser for framework-agnostic reactive state
Worker placement: collab worker → crdt crate (Loro-specific), embed worker → browser crate
crdt: collab worker - Loro sync + iroh P2P in worker thread
weaver-editor-crdt includes AT Protocol integration: PDS sync (edit.root/diff records), session records for collab discovery
crdt: PDS sync - edit.root/diff record management, draft persistence
crdt crate generic over document primitive where reasonable - not hardcoded to Entry lexicon, enables reuse for other AT Protocol record types
Architecture pattern: core defines platform traits, browser/native implement them. Enables multi-platform support.
weaver-editor-browser crate scaffolded - cursor module with BrowserCursor impl CursorPlatform
CursorPlatform API cleanup: removed unused editor_id param from restore_cursor and get_cursor_rect - element lookup uses mapping.node_id directly
core: actions.rs with Range, EditorAction, InputType, Key, Modifiers, KeyCombo
core: text_helpers.rs with find_line_start/end, word boundaries, list detection
weaver-editor-browser and weaver-editor-core compile with extracted actions, text helpers, and events

weaver-renderer - already has fetch_and_render

Deduplicated input.rs - ListContext from core, write_clipboard_with_custom_type from browser. Loro-specific text helpers remain (different trait interface).

edges.rationale: Building weaver.sh required choosing a frontend technology
Building weaver.sh required deciding on editor approach
Weaver needed a better AT Protocol library, so jacquard was built
Weaver needed an indexing backend for efficient queries
Dioxus chosen - wanted to write frontend in Rust
JS frameworks rejected - wanted pure Rust stack
Custom editor chosen - no Rust alternatives, custom markdown needs, performance
JS editors rejected - not Rust, wouldn't support custom markdown well
Custom editor led to text storage decisions
Custom editor led to input handling decisions
JumpRope initially chosen for fast edits and UTF-16 support
Ropey chosen for core extraction - mature, byte/char indexing
Loro chosen for CRDT/collab features - adds ~500KB
beforeinput interception chosen - full control, no sync bugs
Hidden textarea rejected - sync hell, IME issues
Dual-backend chosen for latency + scale balance
Editor matured, now extracting for embeddability
UX requirement informed editor approach decision
Custom markdown dialect required custom editor
Jacquard built and weaver migrated successfully
Loro integration working for collaborative editing
Weaver needs user authentication to publish
Public client chosen - simpler, works for web app
Subdomain hosting enables cleaner URLs for notebooks
JS bindings enable external apps to render weaver content
Editor extraction and renderer bindings share JS packaging approach
Text storage choice led to buffer migration decisions
Loro chosen for undo + collab foundation
Obsidian-style UX required syntax hiding implementation
Weaver defines custom AT Protocol lexicons
iroh chosen for P2P with relay fallback
Static site theming was part of building weaver.sh MVP
CLI integration enabled command-line static site generation
AT Protocol publishing required a rendering pipeline
chosen - uploads blobs, resolves wikilinks to canonical markdown
chosen - renders canonical markdown to HTML in browser
Weaver needs record editing for notebook entries
chosen - flexible editing with raw JSON and structured form options
Editor integration revealed draft system issues that needed fixing
Editor maturity required fixing deep rendering bugs
Render redesign surfaced additional cursor issues
Weaver needs accessibility compliance for public release
Custom editor needs consistent offset handling across writers
CRDT collab working but needs architecture improvement for bundle size
Editor extraction requires LoroBuffer implementing core traits
JumpRope was initial choice for editor text storage
JumpRope lacked undo/collab, leading to Loro investigation
Investigation led to Loro migration decision
Sidenotes are part of weaver-flavoured markdown dialect
Render pipeline redesign led to segmented writer refactor
OAuth tokens need secure browser storage
chosen - neither share alone reveals secret, data dies with tab
Loro migration enabled full entry schema in CRDT
App live but accumulated technical debt during rapid development
Dual-backend requires concurrency strategy for SQLite shards
chosen - simplest approach, tokio manages blocking threads
chosen - enables swapping between local ropey and collaborative Loro
UI polish for weaver.sh user experience
TextBuffer extraction progressing - nearly production ready
Lexicon definitions implementing the weaver dialect
